p: The prevalence of transmitted DRM was comparable in clustering (47/289, 16.3%) and nonclustering (201/1,108; 18.1%) participants (p = 0.46) ( Appendix Table). Of the 47 sequences harboring DRM, 19 (40.4%) were preferentially shared by participants living predominantly in Cologne (14/19, 73.7%) and Bonn (3/19, 15.8%) ( Figure 2, panel A) and by participants reporting MSM as main risk factor (15/19; 78.9%) ( Figure 2, panel B). Younger age (<25 years) was associated with a higher proportion of shared DRM (3/11; 3.5%) compared with older age (24â€“45 years, 13/856 [1.5%]; >45 years, 2/430 [0.5%]) ( Table 1).
